communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Sebastian 2.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:
https://cbs12.com/news/local/sebastian-woman-accused-of-leaving-kids-in-hot-car-while-shoplifting-at-walmart-sebastian-police-department-florida-march-21-2025

Exact date of incident: March 20, 2025
Names of parties involved:  Katherine Gordon
Location: Walmart, located at 2001 US-1


I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.

I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.

Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.


Best regards,
George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Sebastian 2.
communications.communication:
Good morning,

This request has been completed.  Please see the attached cost sheet prior to mailing a copy of the redacted BWC/In car videos.

The following was redacted:

119.071(2)(I)(c) – body camera videos taken in a place that a reasonable person would expect to be private

     *   Some of the interaction was conducted in places that the general public shopping at Walmart does not have access to and would be expected to be private.
119.0714(1)(c) – information revealing surveillance techniques
FCIC/NCIC and Criminal Justice Information: 119.071(2)(b) and 943.053(2)
Marsy’s Law – Victims information (juveniles)
HIPPA – Medical information given to victims
119.011(3)(d) – Active Criminal Investigative Information

Thank you,

Evidence Department
Sebastian Police Department
1201 Main St.
Sebastian, FL 32958
772-589-5233 Ext: 5530

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: challenge Coin Program (CIA)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents including:
-any index of CIA challenge coins created from 1980s to the present date.
-documents detailing the CIA challenge coin creation process
-any funding or expenditure documents related to the creation of challenge coins
-guidelines or manuals for creating CIA challenge coins
-internal policies regarding challenge coins and what designs are appropriate

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emily Crose

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 1973 CIA personnel reduction in Vietnam
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files mentioning or discussing the 1973 CIA personnel reduction in Vietnam described in LOC-HAK-38-3-3-3.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000 readers in outlets such as MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the People, AND Magazine, Unicorn Riot, and more. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and and the journalist non-profit, MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

Additionally, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the released information to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v. Dep’t of Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning United States foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media.

Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the nature of the requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee category.

As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

title: City of Newburgh NY Annual Financial Disclosure Letters

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: City of Newburgh NY Annual Financial Disclosure Letters
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide copies of the most recent Annual Financial Disclosure Letter filed by each local officer and employee required to file such letters under Chapter 34, Article II of the City of Newburgh Code. The relevant provisions of the City Code are available at: https://ecode360.com/10870585.

Under Section 34-11 of the City Code, the following officers and employees are required to file Annual Financial Disclosure Letters:
- All elected officials;
- All members of appointed boards or commissions;
- The City Manager;
- All department heads and their deputies, whether employed by the City of Newburgh or any City agency; and
- Any additional City staff whose positions or titles have been designated by the City Council, via resolution or local law, as subject to the disclosure requirements.

We acknowledge that Annual Financial Disclosure Letters may contain certain sensitive private information that may be exempt from disclosure under state or federal law, and we understand that this information may be redacted prior to disclosure under Section 34-14 of the City Code. The Committee on Open Government has provided guidance regarding this issue in several advisory opinions, and the City may find these opinions to be helpful in responding to our FOIL request:
- FOIL-AO-17694: https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f17694.html
- FOIL-AO-13559: https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/13559.htm
- FOIL-AO-f9826: https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f9826.htm
- FOIL-AO-f19757: https://docs.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f19757.html
- FOIL-AO-17351: https://docs.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f17351.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Liberty Street Legal PLLC

title: Police disciplinary files (Chelan County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Chelan County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aspen Ford

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Chelan County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 11, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Chelan County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
Hello—

The Chelan County Prosecuting Attorney’s Office acknowledges receipt of your public records request dated July 11, 2025, which you submitted to our office by email to the address of prosecuting.attorney@co.chelan.wa.us, wherein you requested:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.
Your request has been assigned the reference number of CCPA-PRR25-21.

With respect to the first portion of your request for “all lists, spreadsheets, or other organized datasets … created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States”, attached are copies of the two Brady v. Maryland / PID internal lists created and maintained by our office which are responsive to your request.

With respect to the second portion of your request, could you please clarify for us:


  1.  If you are looking for documents pertaining to law enforcement officers on a statewide basis or just those within our local jurisdiction?
  2.  Is there a specific time frame you are wanting us to focus on when searching for these documents?  From “X” year forward, or just anything we have regardless of year?

If you could please provide us with clarification of your request within the next seven (7) business days, it would be greatly appreciated.  We will then be able to provide you with an estimate of how long it will take for us to provide any materials potentially responsive to the second part of your request.

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,

Cindy Dietz
Office Administrator
Chelan County Prosecuting Attorney’s Office
P.O. Box 2596
Wenatchee, WA  98807
509-667-6204
cindy.dietz@co.chelan.wa.us<mailto:cindy.dietz@co.chelan.wa.us>

communications.communication:
September 9, 2025
ATTN: ASPEN FORD

Hello Aspen-

The Chelan County Prosecuting Attorney's Office has completed its search for records in response to your July 11, 2025, public records request you submitted to our office by email to the address of prosecuting.attorney@co.chelan.wa.us (our reference number CCPA-PRR25-21).

On July 18, 2025, we provided you with copies of our office's two internal Brady/PID Lists in response to the first part of your request for "all lists, spreadsheets, or other organized datasets ... created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States."  Because those two lists have since been updated, we are providing you with updated copies of those lists.

In our email of July 18, 2025, we also asked if you could clarify the second portion of your request for "any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers."  On July 23, 2025, you responded with:


  1.  I'm looking for officers both in your local jurisdiction and statewide.
  2.  I'm seeking any records you all maintain, regardless of year.

Our office has located 114 documents/files (approximately 83 MB) of responsive records to provide you in response to the second portion of your request.  When you and I spoke back in July, you indicated I could upload our responsive records through the link provided with your initial request, which was:

View request history, upload responsive documents, and report problems here:
https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchelan-county-prosecuting-attorney-35584%252Fpolice-disciplinary-files-chelan-county-prosecuting-attorney-189437%252F%253Femail%253DProsecuting.Attorney%252540co.chelan.wa.us&url_auth_token=AAGs-YaqqtdwBrm4yCd9Z0Mlj90%3A1ueeqi%3AvvydlMSSSLtvhQHLLK462Qs0c6aZRe7tV_SoMlt6w78

LYEUWFWJ
I have clicked on the above link as requested, but I keep receiving this error message:

[cid:image001.png@01DC219B.FE456340]

Since I cannot access the above site to upload our office's responsive records, I am providing them to you through our secure file transfer protocol, Liquid Files.  The link to access/download the records from Liquid Files is located at the bottom of this email.  (Please note that the Liquid Files link provided at the bottom of this email can ONLY be opened by this email recipient; it cannot be forwarded to another email address.  If there is another email(s) address to which you would like these records sent, please provide me with the other email address(es) and I will be happy to resend this email and Liquid Files link to the other email address(es) provided.)

None of the responsive materials being provided by our office have been redacted or determined to be exempt or withheld from disclosure based on statutory exemption.

Our office believes we have provided all records responsive to your request for public records dated July 11, 2025, and now considers your request fulfilled and closed.  Because this office does not intend to further address your request, we are notifying you that the Public Records Act's one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review pursuant to RCW 42.56.550(6) is now in effect.

If you have any follow-up questions, please don't hesitate to contact our office by phone at 509-667-6522 or by email at prosecuting.attorney@co.chelan.wa.us by September 22, 2025.

Sincerely,
Cindy

title: Library Contract Request: ProQuest Ebook Central (Kean University)

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Library Contract Request: ProQuest Ebook Central (Kean University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with Clarivate / ProQuest relating to the licensing of ProQuest Ebook Central;
All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with Clarivate / ProQuest for ebook licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of ProQuest Ebook Central.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

smhc

title: Use of force (response to resistance) guidance, policies, and data (St Michaels Police Department FOIA)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Use of force (response to resistance) guidance, policies, and data (St Michaels Police Department FOIA)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records related to this agency's policies on and reporting of uses of force and responses to resistance:

• Policies. 
Any and all policies guiding appropriate and inappropriate uses of force by any member or representative of this agency. These may also include “Response to Resistance” policies and similar guidance.

Please also provide all policies regarding the use of lethal, less-lethal, and non-lethal weapons (for example: TASERs pepper ball guns, rubber bullets, gases, sprays, water, etc.), including all policies regarding borrowing, accessing, or assuming responsibility for such weapons,  tools, and ammunition. 

Please also provide all policies or guidance related to reporting or tracking discharges from or uses of such weapons, as well as any other applicable policies or directives related to the acquisition, use, and reporting of weapons or tools. 

Please also provide all policies and guidance used to evaluate any use of force or adjudicate administrative and internal investigations into any use of force or weapon discharge.

• Instructions for reporting. Any and all instructions and guidance related to the reporting of uses of force by any member or representative of this agency.

• Forms, coding descriptions, and other guidance.
All forms, codes, guides, and guidance used in the reporting and review of uses of force or weapons, including:
Any list of codes or definitions for terms or tags used in the reporting, collection, or review of uses of force. 
A blank version of each form, log, and other documentation used to report or track uses of force by this agency.  
A blank version of each form, log, and other documentation used to report or track the borrowing or use of lethal, less-lethal, and non-lethal weapons
A blank version of each form, log, and other documentation used to report or track any discharge of force from firearms, tools, or weapons employed by this agency
A copy of any guidance, requirements, laws, and policies issued by the state, including those issued as part of grant or other funding requirements, regarding this agency’s responsibilities for reportings uses of force or weapons
A copy of any guidance, requirements, laws, and policies issued by the federal government, including those issued as part of grant or other funding requirements, regarding this agency’s responsibilities for reportings uses of force or weapons

• Use of Force Data 
For the period from January 1, 2019 through December 31, 2019 and the period from January 1, 2020 through July 31, 2020, data on the each use of force by representatives of this agency, including but not limited to: 
Date, time: The date (month, day, year) and time of the incident
Location: Street address, block, and other relevant location information
Subject(s) information: race, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, resultant or related injuries sustained or alleged, weapon type (if applicable) in the possession of each involved individual, arrests or charges associated with the incident
Officer information (for each involved officer): employee number or other unique identifier used for the officer, race, resultant or related physical injuries, patrol division, unit
Incident details: incident or other unique identification number for the use of force incident
Type of force details: a description of each type of force used
Body camera or other footage: Inventory of any video record was created of the incident and/or a copy of the captured footage from all present cameras
Disposition of investigation into the incident: The current or final status of each use of force incident, including whether challenges to the use of force were sustained or dismissed or if the incident had no or is currently under investigation
Please provide the information as a csv spreadsheet, if possible, and if not possible, please provide incident reports sufficient to show the requested data. 

• Discharge Report Data 
For the period from January 1, 2019 through December 31, 2019 and the period from January 1, 2020 through July 31, 2020, data on each discharge of a firearm and other weapons by representatives of this agency, including but not limited to: 
Date, time: The date (month, day, year) and time of the incident
Location: Street address, block, and other relevant location information
Incident description and details
Tool or weapon used, including any unique identifier or identification number
Number of discharges
Subject(s) information: race, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, resultant or related injuries sustained or alleged, weapon type (if applicable) in the possession of each involved individual, arrests or charges associated with the incident
Officer information (for each involved officer): employee number or other unique identifier used for the officer, race, resultant or related physical injuries, patrol division, unit
Type of force details: a description of each type of force used
Disposition or status of any investigation or follow-up review of the incident
Please provide the information as a csv spreadsheet, if possible, and if not possible, please provide incident reports sufficient to show the requested data. 

If any portion of materials responsive to this request should be deemed unavailable or non-disclosable, please specifically identify the portions of the records or the specific information that is unavailable and the reason for the unavailability. 

If any portion of this request is unclear or if this request could be modified to reduce the burden of producing responsive documents or provide them more efficiently or expeditiously, please reply with a request for clarification or a proposed modification.

This request is being made by a reporter as part of a journalistic investigation. It is being submitted as part of a project to better understand uses of police force nationwide, which has been of public interest for many years and which is of particular interest to large new swaths of the public following the widely-seen death of George Floyd and the First Amendment-protected demonstrations and public discussion that have followed. There is no commercial interest in the submission of this request or the release of these records.

In the event that there are fees appropriately assessed in association with this request, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Maryland Public Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 29, 2020. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

Information collected can be found in our policies.
https://www.stmichaelsmd.gov/police/page/policy-manual

Additionally, there were no use-of-force complaints to report for the period from January 1, 2019 through December 31, 2019 and for the period from January 1, 2020 through July 31, 2020.

Please refer to the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission for State guidelines.
https://mpctc.dpscs.maryland.gov/pdf/Mandated%20Reporting%20Summary%20of%20Requirements.pdf

We can be reached at 410-745-9500.

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: Re: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. North,

This email shall serve to confirm receipt of your FOIA dated August 21,
2025 and received by Mott Community College August 22, 2025.
The College is requesting the ten day extension allowable under FOIA as it
is necessary to gather the requested documents.
We will respond on or before September 12, 2025.

For more information on Mott's policy, go to
https://www.mcc.edu/foia/index.shtml.

Sincerely,

communications.subject: Re: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. North,



The college has received your FOIA request, dated August 21, 2025. Your
request has been *GRANTED*. The attached includes;



·       Agreement for vending (distribution) and the Coffee Beanery
agreement.



This is submitted as the official college response to your request.



Please contact me if you are unable to open the attached documents.

For more information on Mott's policy, go to
https://www.mcc.edu/foia/index.shtml.
Regards,

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: General Inmate Records :: G023745-090825
communications.communication:
Dear Dillon Bergin: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Georgia Department of Corrections. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Open Records Act, O.C.G.A. 50-18-70, et seq. Your request was received in this office on 9/8/2025 and given the reference number G023745-090825 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-corrections-3973%252Fbanned-books-list-department-of-corrections-192511%252F%253Femail%253Dopen.records%252540gdc.ga.gov&url_auth_token=AAANHdxFsVOUIK47DhzN32a0s9U%3A1uvpJC%3A14cffogqrOnGvRnm5Xpe6CkEicS9mpjBmC4pBO9A-jQ 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
PLEASE NOTE: The Open Records Act does not require a governmental body to prepare new reports, summaries, or compilations not in existence at the time of the request, or to answer questions. 
Sincerely, 
Georgia Department of Corrections 
You can monitor the progress of your request in " My Records Center"

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Attached is the record you requested.  Please be informed that ABARTA Coca-Cola Beverages, LLC has asserted that certain information in its agreement is trade secret under R. C. 1333.61. Therefore, this information is exempt from disclosure. R.C. 149.43(A)(1)(v). State ex. Rel. Besser v. Ohio State University et al., 89 Ohio St.3d 396; State ex rel. Luken v. Corporation for Findlay Market of Cincinnati, 135 Ohio St.3d 416.

Thank you,
Office of General Counsel

communications.subject: [External Message Added] San Bernardino County public records request #25-22519
communications.communication:
San Bernardino County ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-22519: September 09, 2025 Re: Request #25-22519 Dear Rachel Morgan: The San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department (Department) has concluded its review of your Public Records Act request. The records you have requested constitute confidential investigative records. Government Code section 7923.600, subdivision (a) exempts from California Public Records Act disclosure “any investigatory or security files compiled by any other state or local police agency, or any investigatory or security files compiled by any other state or local agency for correctional, law enforcement, or licensing purposes.” These records are exempt from disclosure, even if the prospect of enforcement proceedings is not concrete and definite. (Haynie v. Superior Court (2001) 26 Cal.4th 1061,1069; Black Panther Party v. Kehoe (1974) 42 Cal.App.3d 645, 654; Younger v. Berkeley City Council (1st Dist. 1975) 45 Cal.App.3d 825, 833; American Civil Liberties Union Foundation v. Deukmejian (1982) 32 Cal.3d 440.) The records remain protected from disclosure even after an investigation has concluded. (Williams v. Superior Court (1993) 5 Cal.4th 337, 355–362.) Further, the release of such records could violate the privacy rights of involved parties and others named and/or depicted therein. The California Public Records Act recognizes that the right to privacy is a fundamental interest that the California Constitution protects. (Cal. Const., art. I, § 1; Gov. Code, §§ 7927.700 and 7927.705.) For the reasons outlined above, your request is respectfully denied. Without waiving the foregoing objections, exemptions, or privileges the Department provides a copy of the press release related to this incident. Duplication costs have been waived. Sincerely, San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at San Bernardino County.

Technical support: See our help page

title: GRAMA Request for Dylan Rounds Case Records

communications.subject: Government Records Access and Management Act Request: GRAMA Request for Dylan Rounds Case Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to Utah’s Government Records Access and Management Act (GRAMA, Utah Code § 63G-2), I respectfully request the following records related to the disappearance and murder of Dylan Rounds in Box Elder County (May 2022 – April 2024), including the prosecution of suspect James Brenner:

- All body-worn camera recordings from responding or investigating officers.
- All dashcam or in-car camera video.
- Any interview or interrogation room recordings (audio or video).
- All 911 call recordings, CAD dispatch logs, and radio communications related to the case.
- Complete incident, arrest, investigative, and supplemental reports.
- Any evidence photos or videos collected during the investigation.

If any portion of these records is exempt from disclosure, please release all reasonably segregable portions and provide the statutory basis for any redactions.

This request is being made for journalistic/documentary purposes, and the disclosure of these records is in the public interest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Shaw

communications.subject: GRAMA Request - Brenner Files
communications.communication:
Mr. Shaw,

Box Elder County has received your request for records related to the
disappearance and murder of Dylan Rounds. This meets the criteria for an
official request under the Utah Government Records Access and Management
Act.

The County has made all of the files related to this case, referred to as
the Brenner case, available publicly for the media to access and review.

You will find a link to all of the publicly released files here,
https://www.boxeldercountyut.gov/462/Box-Elder-County-Release-of-Records-from


There were a small number of records that were not released publicly that
are listed on the index with the explanation of why they were classified as
private or protected.

After you've reviewed these files, if you feel that there is anything
additional that you need, please submit a new GRAMA request with those
details. You can submit GRAMA requests through our online portal,
https://boxeldercounty.justfoia.com/publicportal/home/track

Thank you,
--

Official Military Personnel File (OMPF) for Thomas Frosch , Captain (Retired)

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.". Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per FOIA, 5 U.S.C. §552 we process FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although the goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time-period. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner. 

We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00 in processing costs. You will be contacted before any additional fees accrue. 

If you have any questions or wish to discuss reformulation or an alternative time-period for the processing of your request, please contact the FOIA office. Your request has been assigned reference number 2025-NavyFOIA-010074.  Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. 

Sincerely, 

SECNAV/CNO FOIA/PA Program Office

Office Phone: (202) 685-0412

communications.subject: FOIA Received 2025-NavyFOIA-010074
communications.communication:
Good Day, 

 

          Your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request of August 4, 2025 has been received by the Navy Personnel Command (NPC).  This command received your request on August 5, 2025. Your FOIA request number is 2025-NavyFOIA-010074 and your FOIA correspondence file number is 5NPC0880.

 

          The records you seek require a search in and/or consultation with another office, and so your request falls within the "unusual circumstances" See 5 U.S.C. § 552 (a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii).  Because of these unusual circumstances, we may need to extend the time limit to respond to your request beyond the twenty days provided by the statute.  For your information, we use multiple tracks to process requests, but within the tracks we working an agile manner.  The time needed to complete our work on your request will necessarily depend on a variety of factors, including the complexity of a records search, the volume and complexity of any material located, and the order of receipt of your request.  At this time we have assigned your request to the complex track.  Any decision with regard to the application of fees will be made only after we determine whether fees will be implicated for this request.   

 

If you have questions or concerns my contact information is below.

 

Sincerely,

ERIN J. RAMIL

Bureau of Naval Personnel

Office of Legal Counsel

FOIA/PA Officer, BUPERS-00J6 

erin.j.ramil.civ@us.navy.mil

(901) 874-3165

title: FOIA records pertaining to the arrest of Daniel L. Holmgren on January 24th, 2023

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: FOIA records pertaining to the arrest of Daniel L. Holmgren on January 24th, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

Arrest reports

All body-worn camera footage of the arrest

Dash cam footage from patrol cars that shows Holmgren being transported 

Any audio or video recordings that had anything to do with this incident 

The request pertains the charges of 1st degree attempted murder, 1st degree use of deadly force against peace officer/prosecuter/judge or correction

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Dillard

title: Rifle inventory records (Fresno County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Fresno County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles).
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code,  privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.
 
The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles). 2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code, privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.  Regarding your request for #1: Per Government Code Section 7922.535(a), we have reviewed your request and determined we have disclosable records responsive to your request. The Fresno County Sheriff's Office has added your request to our PRA processing queue. The current estimate to have your records available is on or around August 28, 2025, although we may be able to process it sooner. Once we review what records we have, we will be in contact with you regarding costs to release those records. Regarding your request for #2: Per Government Code Section 7922.535(a), we have reviewed your request and determined we have no disclosable records responsive to your request. Sincerely, Public Records Act Unit Fresno County Sheriff's Office ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? title: Radio and Technical Equipment Purchased by the Soviets

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Radio and Technical Equipment Purchased by the Soviets
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files captioned "Radio or Technical Equipment Purchased by the Soviets", including 105-HQ-30365. This program was described in a 1975 memo as  "Recording of Soviet purchases in such areas -- intelligence and counterintelligence purposes." (https://www.archives.gov/files/research/jfk/releases/2018/docid-32989624.pdf)

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1497857-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 152 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 922 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,964 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for the email confirmation concerning this request.  We have noted that you are still interested in the potentially responsive documents at this time.

We will move forward with processing without reducing the scope of this request.

Any future status inquires please go to foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>
Respectfully,

Negotiation Team
Federal Bureau of Investigation
Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>

Status Checks: https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps | foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>
For additional information, please visit the www.fbi.gov/foia<http://www.fbi.gov/foia> website.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: N6: Staff Personnel files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

Fernando Kim, Network Chief
Ethan Netterstrom, Network Chief

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums and interview summary reports, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Welcome to the FOIA Center!
communications.communication:
Thank you for registering with the CPS FOIA Center. Please log in to the FOIA Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 Your Login ID is:  188438-18773705@requests.muckrock.com If you did not submit your request through the Records Center but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password. (https://cps.mycusthelp.com/webapp/_rs/forgotpassword.aspx?)

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fpersonnel-network-6-188438%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1uUdFu%3AY0AesxfyeE5OHpK6Z4bruA3JecKT2bRjraEDTtSVeog 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=17810

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums and interview summary reports, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements. 

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fpersonnel-network-6-188438%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1uUdFu%3AY0Aesxfye5OHpK6Z4bruA3JecKT2bRjraEDTtSVeog RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, citizenship status, signatures, personal addresses/phone numbers, medical information, GPAs, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r), which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of students and any student records in which a student may be individually identified by a school regardless of how or where the information pursuant to (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Redactions have also been made in accordance with 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(j)(iii) which exempts from release information concerning a school or university’s adjudication of student disciplinary cases, but only to the extent that disclosure would unavoidably reveal the identity of the student. The identities of complainants have been redacted pursuant to section 7(d)(iv) of the FOIA which exempts confidential information furnished only by the confidential source, or persons who file complaints with or provide information to administrative, investigative, law enforcement, or penal agencies. 
Certain incident report entries and outcries related to this request are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). This section exempts from disclosure information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law. Specifically, the Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act, section 325 ILCS 5/1, states that all records concerning reports of child abuse and neglect or records concerning referrals under this Act and all records generated as a result of such reports or referrals, shall be confidential and shall not be disclosed except as specifically authorized by this Act or other applicable law; and 820 ILCS 40/13 of the Illinois Personnel Records Review Act, which prohibits the identification of individuals who are the subject of an unfounded DCFS report. 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: BPD Incident Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, G.L. c. 66, § 10, I am submitting the following request for records.

I respectfully request a limited set of data from the Boston Police Department’s internal database related to reported crime incidents from January 1, 2024 through December 31, 2024.

Requested Fields:

Incident_number

Offense_code

Offense_code_group

Offense_description

District

Reporting_area

Shooting (Yes/No)

Occurred_on_date

Year, Month, Hour_of_day

UCR_Part

Street (or nearest block if redaction is needed)

Latitude, Longitude, Location

Officer Identifier (Employee_ID or pseudonymous ID)

Officer Rank (at time of incident)

If any of these fields are unavailable, please let us know. If specific rows require extensive redaction under Exemptions C or F (e.g., juvenile involvement, sexual assault, witness protection), we understand and are willing to accept the dataset excluding those specific records if that significantly reduces the burden on the Department.

We are not requesting personal information on victims, witnesses, or arrestees.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
BU SPARK!

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Energy and Innovation Summit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Pennsylvania Energy and Innovation Summit took place July 15, 2025 at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) in Pittsburgh, PA. Media reporting has indicated that the Secret Service was involved in discussions about a fence being painted on the CMU campus: https://triblive.com/local/fence-fight-cmu-orders-students-anti-trump-message-painted-over-ahead-of-presidents-visit/

I request the following information:

1) Email communications containing any of the terms (not case sensitive) "fence", "paint", "repaint", "re-paint", "no rapists on our campus", "protest the summit", or "stop the summit" sent to or from an email address ending in @cmu.edu, @andrew.cmu.edu, or any other subdomain of cmu.edu between July 1, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

2) All communications (including emails, calendar invites, meeting notes, and other correspondence) with Farnam Jahanian (including but not limited to farnam@cmu.edu, farnam@andrew.cmu.edu, or president@andrew.cmu.edu), Gina Casalegno (gina.casalegno@cmu.edu or ginac@andrew.cmu.edu), and Daryl Weinert (dweinert@cmu.edu or dweinert@andrew.cmu.edu) between June 1, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Benjamin Weinshel

All audio and video recording from the Tourism Commission Meeting on July 14, 2025

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gary Milliette

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Lake Geneva Tourism Commission Recordings
communications.communication:
Hello,

The City is in receipt of your open records request. Please be aware of the following if applicable:
·                     The charge for copies of records is 25 cents per side of page.
·                     The charge for any other media is at the actual cost.
·                     Pursuant to 19.35(3)(f), Wis. Stats., if the amount to be imposed is more than $5.00, the authority may require prepayment.
·                     Pursuant to Section 19.35(3)(c), Wis. Stats., if the cost to locate the record will cost more than $50.00, the authority may require payment of the location costs.
·                     If a record request response is mailed, the authority may charge the actual postage amount, to be paid before mailing.
·                     The City is not obligated to provide records in the format requested. Grebner v. Schiebel, 2001 WI App 17, 240 Wis.2d 551.
·                     The City is not obligated to provide records in a time frame established by the requester. Reasonableness of the response time is determined by the volume of records requested, the ability to locate the records, review of records for possible redaction, and other work assignments. Journal Times v. City of Racine Bd. of Police & Fire Comm’rs, 2015 WI 56, 362 Wis.2d 577; WIREdata Inc. v. Village of Sussex, 2008 WI 69, 310 Wis.2d 397.
We are in the process of evaluating your request and will provide further information as it becomes available.

Thank you,

Vanessa Jahns

Deputy City Clerk
City of Lake Geneva
626 Geneva St
Lake Geneva, WI 53147
P: (262) 249-4093
F: (262) 248-4715
Population: 8,941
[logo 2]

Elected Officials and Members of City Committee or Commission: In order to comply with Open Meetings Requirements, please limit any reply to only the sender of this email.

title: FOIL: Enrollment Projection Source Data including Live Birth Data and Communications (Connetquot Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL: Enrollment Projection Source Data including Live Birth Data and Communications (Connetquot Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Live Birth Data including constant birth rate, long term, short term and average birth rates for within the district for current and previous 6 years.

Birth to Kindergarten Survival Ratio used for the past 10 years by year.

Projected Kindergarten Enrollment for the past 10 years by year, and supporting data.

Any communications with NYS DOH or County DOH or other data service provider requesting, receiving or inquiring regarding live birth data, birth to kindergarten survival rate or other statistical data used for projecting enrollment.

Copies of all enrollment projections for the past 6 years and source statistical data, including but not limited to live birth data which were used to provide projected enrollment data upon which securities purchasers rely.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

Connetquot CSD

This email and any files transmitted with it may be confidential and are 
intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are 
addressed and may contain information that is proprietary, privileged, 
confidential and/or exempt from disclosure under applicable law. If you are 
not an intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any viewing, 
copying, disclosure or distribution of this information may be subject to 
legal restriction or sanction. Please notify the sender, by electronic mail 
or telephone, of any unintended recipients and delete the original message 
without making any copies. Please note that any views or opinions presented 
in this email are solely those of the author and do not necessarily 
represent those of the Connetquot Central School District. Finally, the 
recipient should check this email and any attachments for the presence of 
viruses. The Connetquot Central School District accepts no liability for 
any damage caused by any virus transmitted by this email.

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: City of McGregor Blocked Facebook Accounts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The list of all people/accounts who's comments are blocked from being seen on the City of McGregor's Facebook page.

Screenshots of the blocked list would suffice for this request if that's the easiest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brent McCain

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Stanely Sporkin (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Stanley Sporkin (February 7, 1932 – March 23, 2020), who was a director of enforcement for the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), general counsel for the Central Intelligence Agency and United States federal judge of the United States District Court for the District of Columbia. This request includes, but is not limited to, any internally produced history studies which deal with Mr. Sporkin and his time as general counsel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best
